titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-56, by Mr. Goss.

Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules on May 8, 2001 providing for consideration or disposition of any conference report to accompany the conference report on H. Con. Res. 83.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 20.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 131.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
POSTPONED ROLL CALL VOTE - The House postponed further proceedings on the adoption of the resolution until approximately 6 p.m.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 200 (Roll no. 100).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/4/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Waives the requirement under rule XIII of the House of Representatives of a two-thirds vote to consider a Committee on Rules report on the same day it is presented to the House, with respect to any resolution reported by such Committee on May 8, 2001, providing for consideration or disposition of a conference report on H.Con. Res. 83 (congressional budget).
